author: Staff Reporter
text:
Case against her under provisions of Representation of People Act

DMDK founder Vijayakant’s wife and party leader Premalatha courted trouble on Saturday for urging voters to “accept cash for votes”.

At a public meeting here on Friday night, Ms. Premalatha had said voters could accept money from Dravidian parties as they were just returning the wealth looted from the people.

Acting on a complaint filed by Maragathanathan, the Tahsildar of Tirunelveli, the Tirunelveli Town Police registered a case against her under provisions of the Representation of People Act and Indian Penal Code for “encouraging” voters to accept cash for votes.

Mr. Maragathanathan had also claimed that her statement was a violation of the Model Code of Conduct.

However, later Ms Premalatha claimed that her intent was not to encourage bribing of voters.
title: Premalatha in trouble for ‘bid to bribe voters’
